episode_summary: This episode features discussions on a state-sanctioned dance in East Germany, the significance of folding chairs in medieval burials, prenatal reactions to kale, and the eccentricities of architect Erno Goldfinger.

facts.fact: In communist East Germany in the 1950s, the state came up with a sanctioned dance for their teenagers to do.
In the 7th century, one of the most impressive things you could be buried with was a folding chair.
Most people dislike kale before they're even born.
Goldfinger was such a difficult boss that he once fired someone who didn't even work for him.
